intro: Carum meoides, commonly known as meadow caraway, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of Europe. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are arranged in umbels, and it produces small, oval seeds that are used in traditional medicine. The leaves and seeds contain essential oils that contribute to its distinctive aroma and various medicinal properties.
